Description: Fragment of sub-round handle of a Rhodian pottery transport amphora to sharp turn. Clay fine light red-brown; cream slip. Rectangular stamp.
Production date: 124 BC (see N. Badoud, Le temps de Rhodes, 2015, 143.)
Curator's comments: Petrie Diary (EES Archive XVII 47) p. 184, 9. Name Teisamenos. Perhaps from the same die as Alexandria, Greco-Roman Museum, MGR 256.44.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.1150)
